revised_title: Fossil Remains of Soft Parts in Foraminifera: Discovery in Chalk and Flint
tldr: Gideon Algernon Mantell discovered fossil remains of the soft parts of Foraminifera in the chalk and flint of South-East England. He found that the organization of these animalcules, mainly Xanthidia and Rotalia, is simple and has no relation to Cephalopoda. The shells of these creatures are polythalamous and have pores for tentacles and transparent feelers for locomotion. The digestive organs are composed of bladders or sacs connected by a tube. This research contributes to the understanding of Foraminifera fossilization.
